com.sendev.databasemanager

Class DatabaseManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sendev.databasemanager.DatabaseManager

  • public final class DatabaseManager
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DatabaseManager(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
      Creates a new database manager instance, this will sets up the database options, container and set the output mode to SILENT.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addConnection(java.lang.String name, ConnectionLevel level, Database database)
      Adds a database connection to the connections container, allowing queries to be run against the connection.
      ConnectionContainer getConnections()
      Returns the Database Manager connections container, this is where all your database connections are stored and managed, you can use this instance to add database connections directly, get a specific database connection, get the default connection, disable/remove a connection and more.
      DatabaseOptions options()
      Gets the database options/settings, allowing you to customize how the Database Manager operates and talks to the database.
      DatabaseOutput output()
      Returns the database output instance, allowing you to log information to the console.
      org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin()
      Returns the Bukkit JavaPlugin instance, this is used by some of the internal operations in the Database Manager.
      Collection query(QueryBuilder query)
      Executes the SQL statement generated by the query builder, which returns a single Collection object.
      Collection query(java.lang.String query)
      Executes the given SQL statement, which returns a single Collection object.
      Collection query(java.lang.String connection, QueryBuilder query)
      Executes the SQL statement generated by the query builder, which returns a single Collection object.
      Collection query(java.lang.String connection, java.lang.String query)
      Executes the given SQL statement, which returns a single Collection object.
      int queryUpdate(QueryBuilder query)
      Generates a prepared statement object and executes the SQL statement, which must be an SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statement, such as INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE; or an SQL statement that returns nothing, such as a DDL statement.
      int queryUpdate(java.lang.String query)
      Generates a prepared statement object and executes the SQL statement, which must be an SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statement, such as INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE; or an SQL statement that returns nothing, such as a DDL statement.
      Schema schema()
      Gets the database schema instance, allowing you to create new tables, check if tables exists, rename or modify tables.
      void setOutputMode(OutputMode mode)
      This will change the Database Manager output mode, changing this value will allow DBM to log more or less information to the console, depending on the value you set it to.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseManager

        public DatabaseManager(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
        Creates a new database manager instance, this will sets up the database options, container and set the output mode to SILENT.
        Parameters:
        plugin - The Bukkit plugin instance for the plugin using the Database Manager.
        See Also:
        OutputMode

    • Method Detail

      • options

        public DatabaseOptions options()
        Gets the database options/settings, allowing you to customize how the Database Manager operates and talks to the database.
        Returns:
        The database options instance.

      • schema

        public Schema schema()
        Gets the database schema instance, allowing you to create new tables, check if tables exists, rename or modify tables.

        All the schema queries that are generated and executed are being ran against the default or highest priority connection level.

        Returns:
        The database schema instance.
        See Also:
        ConnectionLevel

      • plugin

        public org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin()
        Returns the Bukkit JavaPlugin instance, this is used by some of the internal operations in the Database Manager.
        Returns:
        The Bukkit JavaPlugin instance.

      • setOutputMode

        public void setOutputMode(OutputMode mode)
        This will change the Database Manager output mode, changing this value will allow DBM to log more or less information to the console, depending on the value you set it to.

        Note: Debug messages has to be enabled from the Database Options

        Parameters:
        mode - The output mode you'd like to use.
        See Also:
        OutputMode, DatabaseOptions

      • output

        public DatabaseOutput output()
        Returns the database output instance, allowing you to log information to the console.
        Returns:
        The database output instance currently set by the DBM.

      • addConnection

        public boolean addConnection(java.lang.String name,
                             ConnectionLevel level,
                             Database database)
        Adds a database connection to the connections container, allowing queries to be run against the connection.

        The connection level will be used to determine the priority of the connection, the top level will always be DEFAULT, after that the it's HIGEST, HIGE, MEDIUM, etc...

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the connection.
        level - The level/priority of the connection.
        database - The database instance, this can be MySQL, SQLite, etc...
        Returns:
        True if the connection was added successfully, or False if the connection name already exists.

      • getConnections

        public ConnectionContainer getConnections()
        Returns the Database Manager connections container, this is where all your database connections are stored and managed, you can use this instance to add database connections directly, get a specific database connection, get the default connection, disable/remove a connection and more.
        Returns:
        The Database Managers connection container.

      • query

        public Collection query(java.lang.String query)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                        java.sql.SQLTimeoutException
        Executes the given SQL statement, which returns a single Collection object.
        Parameters:
        query - an SQL statement to be sent to the database, typically a static SQL SELECT statement
        Returns:
        a Collection object that contains the data produced by the given query; never null
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs, this method is called on a closed Statement, the given SQL statement produces anything other than a single ResultSet object, the method is called on a PreparedStatement or CallableStatement
        java.sql.SQLTimeoutException - when the driver has determined that the timeout value that was specified by the setQueryTimeout method has been exceeded and has at least attempted to cancel the currently running Statement

      • query

        public Collection query(java.lang.String connection,
                        java.lang.String query)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                        DatabaseException
        Executes the given SQL statement, which returns a single Collection object.
        Parameters:
        connection - a specific database connection name that the query should be run against.
        query - an SQL statement to be sent to the database, typically a static SQL SELECT statement
        Returns:
        a Collection object that contains the data produced by the given query; never null
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs, this method is called on a closed Statement, the given SQL statement produces anything other than a single ResultSet object, the method is called on a PreparedStatement or CallableStatement
        java.sql.SQLTimeoutException - when the driver has determined that the timeout value that was specified by the setQueryTimeout method has been exceeded and has at least attempted to cancel the currently running Statement
        DatabaseException

      • query

        public Collection query(QueryBuilder query)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the SQL statement generated by the query builder, which returns a single Collection object.
        Parameters:
        query - a QueryBuilder instance that should be sent to the database, typically a static SQL SELECT statement
        Returns:
        a Collection object that contains the data produced by the given query; never null
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs, this method is called on a closed Statement, the given SQL statement produces anything other than a single ResultSet object, the method is called on a PreparedStatement or CallableStatement
        java.sql.SQLTimeoutException - when the driver has determined that the timeout value that was specified by the setQueryTimeout method has been exceeded and has at least attempted to cancel the currently running Statement

      • query

        public Collection query(java.lang.String connection,
                        QueryBuilder query)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the SQL statement generated by the query builder, which returns a single Collection object.
        Parameters:
        connection - a specific database connection name that the query should be run against.
        query - a QueryBuilder instance that should be sent to the database, typically a static SQL SELECT statement
        Returns:
        a Collection object that contains the data produced by the given query; never null
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs, this method is called on a closed Statement, the given SQL statement produces anything other than a single ResultSet object, the method is called on a PreparedStatement or CallableStatement
        java.sql.SQLTimeoutException - when the driver has determined that the timeout value that was specified by the setQueryTimeout method has been exceeded and has at least attempted to cancel the currently running Statement

      • queryUpdate

        public int queryUpdate(java.lang.String query)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Generates a prepared statement object and executes the SQL statement, which must be an SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statement, such as INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE; or an SQL statement that returns nothing, such as a DDL statement.
        Parameters:
        query - an SQL statement to be sent to the database, typically a static SQL DML statement
        Returns:
        either (1) the row count for SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statements or (2) 0 for SQL statements that return nothing
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs; this method is called on a closed PreparedStatement or the SQL statement returns a ResultSet object
        java.sql.SQLTimeoutException - when the driver has determined that the timeout value that was specified by the setQueryTimeout method has been exceeded and has at least attempted to cancel the currently running Statement

      • queryUpdate

        public int queryUpdate(QueryBuilder query)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Generates a prepared statement object and executes the SQL statement, which must be an SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statement, such as INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE; or an SQL statement that returns nothing, such as a DDL statement.
        Parameters:
        query - a QueryBuilder instance that should be sent to the database, typically a static SQL DML statement
        Returns:
        either (1) the row count for SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statements or (2) 0 for SQL statements that return nothing
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs; this method is called on a closed PreparedStatement or the SQL statement returns a ResultSet object
        java.sql.SQLTimeoutException - when the driver has determined that the timeout value that was specified by the setQueryTimeout method has been exceeded and has at least attempted to cancel the currently running Statement
